frameDefinitions: In this frame a group of Individuals meet to form a Configuration.
In this frame, a Communicator judges the Addressee and then communicates that appraisal directly to the Addressee.
A Controlling_entity has control of a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.
Individuals first encounter each other and make introductions at a particular Time, Place, or Context.
A Speaker addresses a Proposal made by an Interlocutor, either agreeing to it or rejecting it.
frameExamples: The crowd <t>came together</t> in the courtyard.
The principal <t>rebuked</t> the student for cheating on the exam.
She was in <t>control</t> of the empire within two days.
Impressed when he first <t>met</t> Nixon, he had always thought of him as an intelligent man, and believed that Nixon would take a stand for civil rights
They were <t>rebuffed</t> again in the larger city of Provo. CNI
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Individuals</fen> are self-movers who come together.
The <fen>Configuration</fen> describes the resulting formation of the individuals.
<fen>Party_1</fen> is the grammatically more prominent participant in the congregating event.
A grammatically less prominent participant in the congregating event.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the congregating occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the congregating occurs.
The <fen>Communicator</fen> communicates a judgment to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> is jduged by the <fen>Communicator</fen> and receives the message of approval or disapproval.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject on which the <fen>Addressee</fen> is being judged.
The <fen>Reason</fen> is why the Communicator forms the type of judgment they form.
The <fen>Medium</fen> identifies the physical or abstract entity in which the judgment is conveyed.
An action or entity under the control of the <fen>Communicator</fen> that expresses the criticism or praise directed towards the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The point in time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> berates or compliments the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> admonishes the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
A thing or person whose behavior controls a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>.
A situation whose temporal or other characteristics are influenced by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>.
A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Controlling_entity</fen> effects the <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the controlling occurs.
The location at which the controlling occurs.
The event that elicits a <fen>Response</fen>.
The means action or judgement in response to the <fen>Trigger</fen>.
The point in time when <fen>Response</fen> is made to the <fen>Trigger</fen>.
The location in which the <fen>Response</fen> action takes place.
The persons (or in rare cases animals) that make each other's acquaintance.
The semantically more prominent one of the two parties when the Individuals are realized separately.
The semantically less prominent of the two parties when the <fen>Individuals</fen> are expressed separately.
The time when the Individuals make each other's acquaintance.
The location where the Individuals make each others acquaintance.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who communicates the reply or response.

This is the person who made the <fen>Proposal</fen> to the <fen>Speaker</fen> and to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates  their response. This frame element stands in for the <fen>Proposal</fen> and is only licensed when the <fen>Proposal</fen>  can be understood from the context.
The <fen>Proposal</fen> is the prior communication or action to which a response is given.
The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  makes a verbal response.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The crowd</fex> gathered on the streets of Paris.
<fex>Our group</fex> met with theirs in the plaza.
Our group met <fex>with theirs</fex> in the plaza.
The teacher scolded the children <fex>about their meessy cookie eating</fex>.
The principal rebuked the student <fex>for cheating on the exam</fex>.
Though she had killed him so long ago, she could still see his jeering <fex>smile</fex>.
She complimented me <fex>almost every morning</fex> on my smart starched shirts.
We were scolded <fex>in the kitchen</fex> by the biggest cook you've ever seen.
Move the slider on the SpeedBar while playing audio or video material to control <fex>playback speed</fex>.
<fex>My wife and I</fex> met in college working in the theatre and we will have been married for 30 years in June 2000.
<fex>Melissa Hurley</fex> had never met her neighbor, Richard Congdon ? the dog owner ? until recently, when she and a reporter knocked on his door.
Gossip reports say she either met <fex>Kennedy</fex> while helping him shop for suits at Calvin Klein, or was contacted by him after he saw her jogging in a New York park
I met my wife <fex>2 yrs ago</fex>.
Bill met his  wife <fex>in Poltava, Ukraine</fex>.
<fex>Iran</fex> on Saturday rejected Europe's proposal for ending the standoff over Tehran's nuclear program.

But senior SLN officials had rebuffed <fex>the man who is ever so willing to please
the guerrillas</fex>.
Dr. Carolyn Herrington has accepted <fex>our offer to become Dean of the College of Education</fex> .
This must make <fex>yesterday's</fex> Taliban rebuff all the more wounding.
Legislation that would have required smaller school districts to share administrators has been rebuffed repeatedly <fex>in the Oklahoma House of Representatives</fex>.
